item.title: Info
item.dc:creator: Miki
item.content:encoded:
Contact:
email@email.com
instagram

In my portfolio, I craft film posters that transcend mere promotional material, becoming visual narratives that evoke the essence of each cinematic masterpiece. With a keen eye for storytelling and a mastery of visual communication, my designs capture the spirit of the films they represent, enticing audiences with a tantalizing preview of the cinematic experience.

item.title: Movie Milton Glasser
item.dc:creator: Miki
item.content:encoded:
Poster for movie Milton Glasser

Milton Glasser

Art, Illustration

Milton Glaser, a legendary American graphic designer, is celebrated for his iconic and versatile body of work that spans several decades. He co-founded the revolutionary Push Pin Studios and is perhaps best known for creating the iconic "I ‚ù§ NY" logo, a symbol recognized worldwide. Glaser's eclectic style, characterized by bold colors, playful illustrations, and a deep understanding of visual communication, has left an indelible imprint on the design world. His influence extends beyond graphic design to include co-founding New York Magazine and leaving a lasting impact on the cultural and visual landscape of the 20th century.

Versions

item.title: Movie Paul Rand
item.dc:creator: Miki
item.content:encoded:
Poster for movie Paul Rand

Paul Rand

Art, Illustration

Paul Rand, a trailblazing American graphic designer, is revered for his pioneering contributions to modern graphic design and corporate branding. Renowned for his minimalist approach and emphasis on simplicity, Rand's work often featured clean lines, geometric shapes, and innovative typography. Notable for creating iconic logos, including those for IBM, ABC, and UPS, Rand's designs seamlessly blended form and function. His profound influence on the field, coupled with his commitment to the idea that design should communicate effectively and enduringly, cements his legacy as a visionary in the world of graphic design.

Versions

item.title: Movie Saul Bass
item.dc:creator: Miki
item.content:encoded:
Poster for movie Saul Bass

Saul Bass

Art, Illustration

Saul Bass, an influential American graphic designer and filmmaker, is widely regarded as a pioneer in the field of film title sequences. Renowned for his innovative approach to visual storytelling, Bass transformed the opening credits of films into powerful and memorable works of art. His iconic designs for films like "Psycho," "Vertigo," and "Anatomy of a Murder" elevated the status of film graphics to an art form. Bass's impact extended beyond the film industry, contributing significantly to corporate branding with iconic logos for companies such as AT&T and United Airlines.

Versions
